narrative.narrative: Aero Airlines was a subsidiary of Finnair that was based at Tallinn,Estonia from 2002 to January 6th,2008 when its last flight was.It flew the Tallinn-Helsinki route and also flew domestic Finland service from Helsinki to Turku and Vaasa. It started with two ATR 72-200's in 2002 and had nine by the end of 2005. Two of them went on to be with UTair of Russia after the airline ceased. At 2007 it had 128 employees. Aero Airlines traced its roots back to 1923 when it flew Junkers seaplanes between the harbors of Tallinn and Helsinki carrying people and mail. It added Stockholm,Sweden and Koenigsberg,Germany (which is now Kaliningrad,Russia). Many people used these as connections to go on to places like Oslo,Norway Copenhagen,Denmark London,England and Berlin,Germany. It started using land based planes in 1938. The airline ceased when Estonia joined the Soviet Union. The Finnish part of the airline remained in Finland and became Finnair eventually, as Finland never became part of the USSR.
